title: Homegoing
author: Yaa Gyasi
review:
"We believe the one who has power. He is the one who gets to write the story. So when you study history, you must ask yourself, Whose story am I missing? Whose voice was suppressed so that this voice could come forth? Once you have figured that out, you must find that story too. From there you get a clearer, yet still imperfect, picture."

This is a book that I will remember for a long while.

It is the first time, despite all the education I have, that I am starting to understand, at a more fundamental level, the historical context for being an African American.

The book beautifully builds up to the ending, and then ends very quickly. After finishing the book and closing it, I just sat there and cried. I felt the immense history that both lineages went through to get to that moment. How unlikely their love is, and how different their paths were.
